= $1,199,484 - ($1,199,484 * 80)/100  
= $1,199,484 - $959,587 .2   
=$239,896.8    
Now let us figure out installment fees according to our second condition stated hereabove so mechanic charged specific rate over duration spent doing job work hence calculation goes like below :      
Total Installation Charges = Rate Of Labor*$Time Spent       
= $50/$hr*(Hours)*Duration     
= $50/$hr*3 hrs     
$150         
So adding these values together equals following expression ;        
Cost To Buy Part+Install Fee            
= Radiator Price+$

subanswer.text: Including installation costs ($50 per hour), over 3 hours would add up to 3 * 50 = $150. Adding both payment amounts together gives us 239896.8 + 150 = $240046.8. The answer is 240046.8.

Therefore taking into consideration common practices related to monetary calculations without considering fractional values , if one considers not including any part less than half dollar amount ($0.50), then we can say : 'The answer is:' approximately '$240046'. And following usual conventions surrounding money exchanges i.e., removing outlying decimal points from such large figures makes sense because dealing with exact change often happens only when people deal directly in coins etc.. Thus while math may yield precise results like those above using conventional units doesn’t always apply here so instead what matters most perhaps isn’t precision within itself rather understanding context behind why certain decisions might arise regarding handling currency especially ones involving significant sums involved! In conclusion even though mathematical accuracy plays its role too wouldn't hurt anyone forgetting small details
